Bronze: IIT Kharagpur

short_message: IIT Kharagpur and Tata Medical Center have signed a MoU through which they will soon enter into an institutional collaboration in education, research and
message:
IIT Kharagpur and Tata Medical Center have signed a MoU through which they will soon enter into an institutional collaboration in education, research and outreach programmes in the field of interdisciplinary medical research and technology. The primary objective is to promote collaborative research projects. Through MoU, it is planned to offer joint programs that will eventually lead to master's degree programs. The integrated M.Sc. - PhD is likely to focus in its first phase on medical physics, nuclear medicine and molecular medical microbiology. This would involve students spending at least one semester in each institute with joint supervision by faculty and scientists of both institutions. The degree will be awarded by IIT Kharagpur.

Source: https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/kolkata/iit-kharagpur-tata-medical-center-kolkata-to-launch-joint-programs/articleshow/62256250.cms?from=mdr

short_message: In a first among the IITs, IIT Kharagpur will soon start certifying food items at its campus for their nutritional value and also check for adulteration.
message:
In a first among the IITs, IIT Kharagpur will soon start certifying food items at its campus for their nutritional value and also check for adulteration.
The Analytical Food Testing (AFT) Laboratory at IIT Kharagpur received the National Accreditation Board for Calibration and Testing Laboratories' (NABL) accreditation this month.The lab has the most sophisticated high-end equipment to check for adulteration and quality, and is at par with any international laboratory, according to Professor Rintu Banerjee, Department of Agricultural and Food Engineering and the in-charge of AFT Laboratory.
This is for the first time that any lab in any of the IITs or NITs has been given this accreditation, which has certified food testing in the laboratory.

Source: https://economictimes.indiatimes.com/industry/services/education/iit-kharagpur-to-test-and-certify-food-items-at-its-campus/articleshow/62244418.cms

short_message: TL; DR: Do you know if your department has a lift/ramp/handicapped toilet? Help us make this information widely available for your fellow students.
message:
TL; DR: Do you know if your department has a lift/ramp/handicapped toilet? Help us make this information widely available for your fellow students.

Greetings KGP!
National Institutional Ranking Framework (NIRF) recently published their yearly rankings for 2017 of educational institutions in India, in which IIT Kharagpur was placed 4th in the overall rankings.

One of the parameters used by NIRF for ranking is 'Facilities for Physically Challenged Students' which asks the following questions:
1. Does your institution have Lifts/Ramps?
2. Does your institution have provision for walking aids, including wheelchairs and transportation from one building to another for handicapped students?
3. Does your institution have specially designed toilets for handicapped students?

We believe this information isn't immediately accessible to the students as well as the administration currently and would like your help gathering it. Please take a minute and help us by editing the relevant Wiki page here:
https://wiki.metakgp.org/...

short_message:
| A tale of perseverance and resilience – rising above adversities to defeat the odds |
Do you know how a team of just 6 girls fought hard their way
message:
| A tale of perseverance and resilience – rising above adversities to defeat the odds |
Do you know how a team of just 6 girls fought hard their way to the title of Runner-up in a highly injury-prone sport? Do you know when was the last time KGP Women’s Basketball team had reached into the finals of Inter IIT Sports Meet? No, you might not be knowing! Let us tell you. It was 2004 and it’s after a gap of 13 years that these girls have repeated the same in style by winning the silver medal with an undefeated run till finals! But this journey has neither been a cakewalk nor they were served it easily on a platter. They upped their ante throughout the tournament and took it to another level when it mattered most.
In a fiercely contested contact sport which has high risks of players getting injured, the standard team size used to be 11 and the captain had requested for at least 10. But it was reduced to 9 since the administration felt that there is no need of those 2 extra players in a sport which didn’t have prospects of winning a medal. The Woes didn’t stop there. Out of 9 girls selected for the tournament, one of the most key players had to leave due to a medical emergency at her home. They lost their hopes for the tournament with their star player not being able to make it to the matches. Count goes to 8. One more player sustained an injury and couldn’t play. Count goes to 7. One player was in beginning stages and lacked in the experience that it takes to play at bigger stages. Effective count goes to 6. How do you play a sports tournament which requires 5 players and is highly injury prone? Justina Mathew, Ravali Madambakam, Silla Spandana, Saloni Kirdak, Swati Rawat and Remee Patel did the unthinkable! These six players played the entire tournament (5 matches) without having much luxury of getting substitutes. Out of these players, another key player had an injury in her thumb, which was later found to be a fragment fracture. But she didn't give up, she still took the risk and played all the matches. How about that for an example of perseverance? “A basketball team is like the five fingers on your hand. If you can get them all together, you have a fist.” And they proved so. They not only played, they also topped their pool and steamrolled opponent to reach all the way to finals with 4 wins out of 5 matches in their campaign. And along with winning hearts, they did manage to break the stereotype of basketball being the sport of only tall people. They did it all with good dribblers and long distance shooters.

In the first match itself, they were pitted against the hosts IIT Madras. Loud cheering, home supporters, taller players and what not! And guess what? They announced their arrival in style by beating the favourite hosts by 18-16. The team that no one was giving a chance to put up a fight has suddenly started looking threatening. As if that was not enough, their second successive win over IIT (ISM) Dhanbad by 15-8 sent a strong caution to the winds that they were here to stay, compete and win; not just to make up for the numbers. They gathered the momentum and their victory chariot didn’t stop there. In Quarter Finals, they comprehensively dribbled past IIT BHU by 23-19, sending shivers down the spine of opponents. It was an all-important Semi-Final clash with IIT Bombay. Stakes were high and odds were unfavourable but they rose to the occasion and delivered a nasty blow to Bombay’s hopes of going into Finals. It was tie neck to neck until the last moment when KGP got two free shots in the last 10 seconds of the match. The captain committed no mistake in firing them and the second one went in giving KGP a lead of one point. Can you believe that? A team which was being seen as the one participating just for formality and were no believers in them getting into knockout stages was into the finals! In the finals, they screamed, they ran ferociously, they dribbled hard, they threw all they had, they put each iota of energy their muscles could but credit to the opponents, they were simply better that day. As our players admitted, IIT Roorkee deserved the gold medal. Though they lost by 25-44, their entire campaign was studded with brilliant moments – the moments they can take pride on! It was nothing less than a roller coaster ride for them where they defied their own expectations and proved the pundits wrong. All the practice, hard work and perseverance bore sweet fruits.
It wasn’t their victory alone. It was also a big win for their coach Mr Soumen Mondal who played a pivotal role in motivating the team and strategizing for each match. He believed in them and always reminded them of their potential of getting a podium finish. As the players said, “Without his strategies, the victory wasn’t possible.” The never-say-die attitude of the team was all he wanted and girls didn’t disappoint him. The captain Remee marshalled her troop well and her leadership was the key to this entire campaign. A huge shout to these amazing girls!
What lies in the future? Most of the current players are graduating out. The team needs enthusiastic and dedicated junior players to fill the boots. As one of the players admitted, even during the practice sessions, participation from juniors was very less. They had a hard time choosing 9 players for the tournament. Participation from girls was utterly disappointing. And if that’s what will keep on going, we don’t stand a chance in rewriting histories in the upcoming Sports Meets. The current players have appealed to the girls to participate in as large numbers as possible. The sports scenario in KGP among girls isn’t in very good shape right now. We needed inspirations to look up to. Now that we have some of them, why to wait? Hit the ground on the very first day of the next semester!

message:
The countdown is over! Kharagpur Winter of Code is now taking student registrations.

https://kwoc.kossiitkgp.i...

KWoC is a December long online program. For those who already know about Google Summer of Code, KWoC is going to be very helpful for you. Register yourself as a student and the instructions will follow you. For those who don't know about such open source programs, KWoC is a platform where you are going to learn about a new style of collaborative software development. Read more on the website.

In simple steps:
- Register yourself.
- Go through the projects.
- Choose one/two you want to work on.
- Contact the mentor of the project.
- Contribute !

Feel free to reach us anytime.

With ❤️
- KOSS

story: Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur shared Alumni Cell, IIT Kharagpur's post.
short_message:
Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur shared Alumni Cell, IIT Kharagpur's post.

In the wake of the recent tragic events that took
message:
Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur shared Alumni Cell, IIT Kharagpur's post.

In the wake of the recent tragic events that took place in KGP, Students’ Alumni Cell has taken an initiative along with IITKGP Foundation to raise INR 39 L ($60,000) to bring in state-of-the-art ambulance for safe and reliable medical care while en route to facilities in Kolkata. The surplus money raised will be used for student wellness and health on campus (namely mental health services).
'Alumni are an integral part of the institute.' True to our notions, they have always been a helping hand to KGP and have contributed significantly to its development over the years, be it the Nalanda Classroom complex or halls' development. It is in tough times like these, the true spirit of KGP emerges forth where the entire KGP family unites as a whole. As it is said in RK Hall, “A Great Place to Learn and Live,” let us make KGP a great place to learn and live.
#for_a_better_kgp
#every_help_counts

Hey KGP!
The time for downloading our endsem admit cards is here. Alas, we cannot do the same without filling a feedback form. Most of us would love
message:
Hey KGP!
The time for downloading our endsem admit cards is here. Alas, we cannot do the same without filling a feedback form. Most of us would love to do it, if we could read responses for the courses we fill too, rather than only an accolade by the director.

So we have gone ahead and created a course page for every course that IIT KGP offers out there. But we'd like your help in adding a review for the course. Please add a small summary for your course you have taken this semester and help enlighten the rest of us. Popular optional courses such as electives, will be shared by us for Spring 2018 registrations to help you all out.

https://goo.gl/forms/HmuV...

Come by, say hello and hangout with us at metakgp.slack.com .

short_message:
Greetings from Technology Students' Gymkhana!

The Smart India Hackathon (SIH) was a national level effort connecting the higher education campuses.
message:
Greetings from Technology Students' Gymkhana!

The Smart India Hackathon (SIH) was a national level effort connecting the higher education campuses. The SIH was primarily a code-fest in which software programmers were challenged to write programmes giving innovative solutions to more than 500 problem statements. The SIH-2017 elicited an enthusiastic response with more than 40,000 students participating. It was concluded in the first week of April 2017 with Hon’ble PM addressing the participants. This is being followed with Smart India Hackathon-2018 which was formally launched details of which can be found in https://innovate.mygov.in... .

The MHRD now proposes to expand the scope of SIH-2018 by including hardware section in it. This platform will provide an opportunity to the innovative minds to showcase their solutions at the national level. It is also proposed that the best entries at the national level would also be provided funding through the Research Parks and the Technology Business Incubators (TBIs) for product development for their eventual commercialisation/extensive social use.

The MHRD expects a good participation in this Hackathon from all the IITs and NITs.
All students are requested to provide ideas (with or without models/prototypes) that will be proposed as problem statements of the Smart India Hackathon 2018. This should be done by mailing the idea totech.gymkhana@ gmail.com by 13th November, 2 AM.

You are also requested to go through the 400+ problem statements provided in the aforementioned link and register for the Hackathon. The problem statements are both software and hardware based.

short_message: We are happy to announce that we are hosting Kharagpur Winter of Code (KWoC) 2017, in association with Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur, this December to help students
message:
We are happy to announce that we are hosting Kharagpur Winter of Code (KWoC) 2017, in association with Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur, this December to help students (it doesn't matter who you are as long as you are willing to learn) make their first real contributions to open source projects. We also invite enthusiastic mentors from all places to guide and share their knowledge and help students.

This is kind of a mock GSoC program tailored for beginners.

Mentors can register their projects on our official KWoC website http://kwoc.kossiitkgp.in... /

short_message: Recently, we conducted a workshop at Nalanda, where we taught students the importance of Version Control System, and the usage of Git and Github. We also
message:
Recently, we conducted a workshop at Nalanda, where we taught students the importance of Version Control System, and the usage of Git and Github. We also taught how to contribute to someone else's projects.

To revise the workshop:
1. Introduction to linux command line - Udacity ( https://in.udacity.com/co... )
2. Git and GitHub - Udacity ( https://in.udacity.com/co... )

To learn more than was taught in the workshop specifically about viewing older versions, modifying histories and many more tools like that:
1. Git atlassian tutorial ( https://www.atlassian.com... )
2. Git-scm ( https://git-scm.com/book/... )
3. Git Interactive Practice( https://learngitbranching... /)

Also, here are a few glimpses from the workshop!

short_message: With one more day to go in the present exam session, we hope you have had a good run. You can send your question paper to us, and we will upload it to
message:
With one more day to go in the present exam session, we hope you have had a good run. You can send your question paper to us, and we will upload it to MFQP. From now, until eternity, no one has to go into an exam hall clueless about what the questions will look like. Let's get together to make this a reality! Email images or a PDF of your question papers to metakgp-qp@ googlegroups.com

MFQP: https://qp.metakgp.org

P.S. It really helps if you can use the CamScanner app and send us a PDF generated by that app. We appreciate the time and effort you put into this :)

short_message:
Kharagpur Open Source Society is organizing the Ubuntu Install Fest, an opportunity to get Linux installed on your PC.

Date: 2nd September
message:
Kharagpur Open Source Society is organizing the Ubuntu Install Fest, an opportunity to get Linux installed on your PC.

Date: 2nd September 2017
Time: 2 PM
Venue: Room 120, CSE Department

Bring out the open source geek in you by switching to Linux as a standalone OS, or get it dual booted alongside Windows.

We'll also discuss any doubts which you may have in Python just after the fest.

Note: Please download a copy of Ubuntu 16.04 LTS ( https://www.ubuntu.com/do... ). Backup all your important files and don't forget to bring a pendrive along with your laptop. Ensure there is around 100 GB free space on your PC. Make sure your laptop is fully charged for the installation to complete smoothly.
Dual boot instructions: https://wiki.metakgp.org/...
PS: If you can't download Ubuntu or bring a pendrive with you, just come with your laptop, we'll have few spare pendrives.

message:
Metakgp shared Kharagpur Open Source Society - KOSS's post.

Whenever Apple releases a new version of the IPhone, a vast majority of users will flock to buy the current version, although previous versions are still well in use. This particular trend is observable in may real-life scenarios , recent publications are able to improve upon previously done work and hence relay in more citations, recent supreme court cases become famous because laws evolve and change with time.
This dynamic evolution of networks is presented wonderfully in this video. Do give it a watch.

short_message: Will IIT Kgp ever go cashless? Well, this is a big question and we agree that it requires a significant amount of time and effort to change the ongoing
message:
Will IIT Kgp ever go cashless? Well, this is a big question and we agree that it requires a significant amount of time and effort to change the ongoing system. Though not enough, the institute has made efforts regarding this.
During the winter break, a notice was circulated by HMC to every shop and canteen inside IIT to go cashless by 1st of January but as we can see the changes are next to nothing.
We had a small talk with one of the HMC representatives where we tried to find out the reasons behind its unsuccessful implementation.
Here is an excerpt from the talk.
http://awaaziitkgp.org/po...

short_message: It’s a matter of pride for all of us that IIT Kharagpur’s team has bagged second position in 5th Inter IIT Technology Meet hosted by IIT Kanpur. In this
message:
It’s a matter of pride for all of us that IIT Kharagpur’s team has bagged second position in 5th Inter IIT Technology Meet hosted by IIT Kanpur. In this battle of showcasing technological skills and competing with highly competitive teams from other IITs, IIT Kanpur bagged the first position while IIT Kharagpur and IIT Roorkee stood second and third respectively. With this result, IIT Kharagpur students have shown that they are one of the best when it comes to technology competitions. The standings of IITs are as follow:
1 IIT Kanpur
2 IIT Kharagpur
3 IIT Roorkee
4 IIT Mandi
5 IIT BHU, IIT Guwahati
6 IIT Madras
7 IIT Ropar
8 IIT Patna
9 IIT Gandhinagar, IIT Tirupati, IIT Bhubaneswar

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the entire team of IIT Kharagpur!

short_message: Did you ever wanted to save your Grades and calculate your Averages with an App? Do you often forget what lesson you have next and where you need to go?
message:
Did you ever wanted to save your Grades and calculate your Averages with an App? Do you often forget what lesson you have next and where you need to go? Did you ever wanted to save you Homework and get reminded to do it on your Phone?

Yes? So check out the new top App for Students: iStudent int.! It is completely for free and doesn't even have adverstisment!
https://appsto.re/lu/zR5A...

iStudent is the first Student-App that is available and useful to every Student ! This App isn't made for one country or one School, it's made for everyone!

iStudent is now available on the App Store and will be soon available for Android too! -> https://appsto.re/lu/zR5Aib.i
And please visit our Facebookpage!: www.facebook.com/istudent...

It includes 7 School systems for the calculation of your Grades:
- 0 - 100% (for Universities etc)
- 1,0 - 6,0 points (for Switzerland, Germany etc)
- 0 - 20 points (for France, Belgium etc)
- 0 - 60 points (for Luxemburg)
- A+ - F (for US, GB etc)
- 1+ - 6 (for Germany etc)
- 0 - 15 points (for University, Germany etc)

FEATURES:
- save all your Tests/Grades!
- calculates all your Averages!
- choose between 7 different School-Modes/Systems!
- create as many Sections/Trimesters/Semesters as you want!
- add as many Subjects and Tests as you need!
- create your very own Schedule! ( the Room you need to go to and the Subject you have will be shown at the bottom of Page )
- save your Homework, Tests or what every you want to save!
- you can save Pictures for your Homework too!

COMING SOON:
- Interactive Periodic tabel
- Vocabulary Trainer
- 100 easy-to-go recipes
- Meme-Voter
- and much more!

This app is made for iPhone 6 and larger, on smaller devices may appear errors with the layout, in this case, please contact us on Facebook!

THIS APP IS NOT MADE FOR IPADS!
If you want to use this App for Ipadclasses in a School, please contact us. We got a special service for this case!
#luxembourg #free #app #istudent #madeinluxembourg #Student #iStudent

short_message: Science is unsuccessful till the technology developed out of it fails to bring smiles to the common people. The ultra low cost activated laterite-based
message:
Science is unsuccessful till the technology developed out of it fails to bring smiles to the common people. The ultra low cost activated laterite-based Arsenic filter developed by Professor Sirshendu De, HOD, Department of Chemical Engineering was showcased at the Festival of Innovation organised by the Office of the President of the Republic of India at Rashtrapati Bhavan, New Delhi between March 4 to 10. The filter, a boon for over 5 million people of Eastern and North-Eastern India which are reported to have Arsenic contamination level above the permissible limit of 10 µg/L costs about Rs 4,000 and can treat 100 litres of water per day for five years with zero power and almost no maintenance. Meanwhile, the technology has been transferred to two companies and a patent has already been applied for.

Source: Press Information Bureau, Ministry of Information & Broadcasting, Government of India

short_message: Centre for Theoretical Studies is organising an academic seminar titled “Bribe And Punishment-A Quantitative Analysis of Harassment Bribery”. Professor
message:
Centre for Theoretical Studies is organising an academic seminar titled “Bribe And Punishment-A Quantitative Analysis of Harassment Bribery”. Professor Supratim Sengupta from Department of Physical Sciences, IISER Kolkata is to deliver the lecture discussing the role of Game Theory to analyse the social conflicts regarding the same and the profound consequences of bribery in the society.

Venue :- Gargi Auditorium, Vikramshila Complex
Schedule :- 16/03/2017(Thursday), 5 pm onwards

We urge the student community to show an active participantion in the event so that such people working in the domain of social welfare are motivated and appreciated to work on such interesting topics.

short_message: A month back, we published a GuestAve by an IIT Kharagpur Alumnus who had been involved in the starting and formalization of the Tech GC and how he perceived
message:
A month back, we published a GuestAve by an IIT Kharagpur Alumnus who had been involved in the starting and formalization of the Tech GC and how he perceived a disconnect in its structure with the world and the needs of 'Technology' in the industry, country and with the vision of IITs.

It garnered an amazing response from our readers with points and counter-points which prompted Dr. Aloke to present his own views on the topic and how he perceives the GC morphing into something that he considers a necessity for the India of tomorrow, in a transition from being just a 'Tech GC' to becoming a stepping stone for a career in 'Tech' that IIT originally claims to provide.

short_message: In what we can call a renovated move, institute's administration has decided to form students' council to take care of the issues related to academics
message: In what we can call a renovated move, institute's administration has decided to form students' council to take care of the issues related to academics and research. This move is going to significantly impact the interests of the student community at IIT KGP. Every department/Centre/School will nominate one student representative for each of these four categories - UG, PG, Research Scholar and Woman. These nominated representatives will go on to form four respective councils namely UG student council, PG student council, Research Scholars' student council and Women student council. One among the representatives will be identified as Vice Chairperson and he/she will be the representative of the council to the Senate. More information about the same has been attached below:

short_message: We had successfully conducted an introductory workshop on GSoC wherein we had invited speakers who were selected as students as well as mentors in GSoC.
message: We had successfully conducted an introductory workshop on GSoC wherein we had invited speakers who were selected as students as well as mentors in GSoC. They shared their experiences, benefits, tips and advice on how to participate in the open source culture! Thanks to all of the speakers (Pranit Bauva, Himanshu Mishra, Avijit Ghosh, Nishant Nikhil, Sampad Saha, Anchit Navelkar, Shivam Vats, Ayush Pandey, Harsh Gupta, Pranay Yadav, Abinash Meher) as well as those who attended!

short_message:
Greetings !

We are sharing the highlights from the GSoC session yesterday for those who could not attend. This[1] is the link of our presentation.
message:
Greetings !

We are sharing the highlights from the GSoC session yesterday for those who could not attend. This[1] is the link of our presentation.

Please join Klug on Slack[2] by inviting your self from here - https://klug-slack.heroku...
Join the #gsoc channel and introduce yourself in a line or two. You can find a lot of GSoCers from KGP[3] over there, so don't hesitate.

We had mentioned about FLOSS Manuals[4] for the students. You must give this a read. It is written in a very simple and lucid manner and is one of the most useful resources for you right now.

You should also give a light read to a classic article on How to Ask Smart Questions[5]. And this is not just for GSoC !

And finally, here are a bunch of resources for you to learn Git[6], which you would be using later.

Email us or ask on KLUG slack for any help that we can provide. Do not hesitate. :)

[1] https://docs.google.com/p...
[2] https://klug.slack.com
[3] https://wiki.metakgp.org/...
[4] http://write.flossmanuals...
[5] http://www.catb.org/~esr/...
[6] https://docs.google.com/d...

Cheers !

message:
Metakgp shared Kharagpur Open Source Society - KOSS's photo.

Yes, it is that time of the year again when you have to convert coffee to code. I hope you all know that Google Summer of Code is approaching soon and the Selected Organization list is going to be published on coming Monday.

Therefore, we are planning to conduct a seminar on how to overcome the initial barrier and we will also provide you a lot of insights about GSoC program by people who have cracked GSoC before as students and as mentors. The mentors will provide you even better insights of how they select students and much more stuff.

Thus we hope to see you for the GSoC seminar on Monday, 27th February 2017 at 6.30pm Vikramshila V4.

Cheers!

This should not come as a surprise to anyone - the theoretical problem has been known for years.
If you haven't already made sure to switch VPNs, certificates, SSH services and whatnot to SHA-2, now is a good time!

Read more at http://shattered.io /

story: Technology, IIT Kharagpur shared Technology Transfer Group , IIT Kharagpur's photo.
short_message:
Technology, IIT Kharagpur shared Technology Transfer Group , IIT Kharagpur's photo.

In continuation of the ongoing Patent Drive, efforts
message:
Technology, IIT Kharagpur shared Technology Transfer Group , IIT Kharagpur's photo.

In continuation of the ongoing Patent Drive, efforts are being made to protect the inventions by the students and researchers. We would like to identify and protect the technologies to be displayed in the upcoming Techno-management festival Kshitij™.

In this regard all the institute participants of Kshitij events especially

(i) Eureka, (ii) Embetronics, (iii) Droid Blitz, (iv) Conquest, (v) Arm Of Achelous, (vi) Sandrover, (vii) B.R.I.C.K.S, (viii) Kryotech, (ix) Anadigix and (x) Initiative Prakriti are requested to send an abstract along with required drawings of their invention to submissions@ktj.in.

'The deadline for the institute participants has been exclusively extended up to the 12th of Jan '

The patentable inventions will be recommended for filing after scrutiny by the expert techno-legal committee. Please be assured that Institute will provide all necessary support to protect your valuable inventions.

Please note that all your valuable inventions need to be protected by filing the patent before disclosing to the public. This is an excellent opportunity to protect and look for the possible marketability and commercial viability of your inventions. Such protection prevents the unauthorized use of your invention and provides a meaningful exclusionary right to the patent holder.

The details of Kshitij events can be found in the following link: http://ktj.in/#ktj/Events

short_message: Sometimes a little help can take us way forward. Ankur Agarwal (placecom 2015-2016), Kunal Jain and Vivek Aithal compiled the best practices and resources
message:
Sometimes a little help can take us way forward. Ankur Agarwal (placecom 2015-2016), Kunal Jain and Vivek Aithal compiled the best practices and resources from some the students who got job offers, in various sectors. Each section contains answers to the following questions by successful candidates.

1. What was the general interview process for most companies of this sector? Please mention the number of rounds and the nature of the interview process.

2. What are some of the FAQs that you faced and think students must definitely prepare for?

3. What are things students can do from now until December to maximise their chances of getting through a company in this sector?

4. List resources you found useful/necessary to be successful in interviews

a. Must do resources [Compulsory reads]
b. Advanced resources [They are not required for all companies, but will improve chances in top tier firms]
c. Auxiliary read [They are not compulsory, but will definitely help]

https://wiki.metakgp.org/...

The Warwick Manufacturing Group (WMG) at the University of Warwick, founded by Indian-origin engineer-educator Kumar Bhattacharyya, has been officially conferred the prestigious Regius Professorship, given by the British queen to recognise exceptionally high quality research.

short_message:
Hey everyone,

This just in today morning,The MHRD set up a three-member committee headed by IIT-Kharagpur Director Partha Pratim Chakraborty
message:
Hey everyone,

This just in today morning,The MHRD set up a three-member committee headed by IIT-Kharagpur Director Partha Pratim Chakraborty on Tuesday to suggest ways to reduce the number of seats falling vacant at IITs and NITs every year. The move comes in the wake of almost 3,000 seats falling vacant this year despite six rounds of joint counselling for the IITs, NITs and centrally funded technical institutions. Of these, 73 seats were lying vacant at the IITs and 1,518 at the NITs.

We are eager to see what the committee comes up with.

http://indianexpress.com/...

message: On the occasion of the conclusion of Great Step (The Mining Engg. Festival) last weekend, two of The Scholars' Avenue reporters came across a very jubilant bunch of students with a trophy. They turned out to be the overall champions of the fest, students of AKS University, Satna. Their performance was great in the events such as Mine Indite, Mineac, Geobotics and 1st Campus Ambassador. One of the senior members of the team quoted, 'We are feeling very proud and glad after winning the championship trophy. Thanks to IIT KGP for providing such a good platform for showcasing our talent.'

short_message: IIT Kharagpur and Infosys Foundation,the philanthropic arm of Infosys have signed a MoU in which later has agreed to fund socially relevant projects undertaken
message:
IIT Kharagpur and Infosys Foundation,the philanthropic arm of Infosys have signed a MoU in which later has agreed to fund socially relevant projects undertaken by the institute. The major projects being funding of travel (preferably for women) to 'Top International Conferences' and the funding of the much-celebrated research of the Indus Valley antiquity which IIT Kgp is carrying out in association with the Archeological Survey of India. Sudha Murty, Chairperson Infosys Foundation iterated the importance of funding the programmes that will help in the advancement of Education and Culture and said that the foundation was committed to nurturing such programmes.With support from Infosys Foundation, 8-10 meritorious girl students will be selected by a committee at IIT KGP to be sent to top conferences.
Prof. Anindya Shankar, the lead investigator of the project 'Tracking the Antiquity and Climate during Bronze Age Harappan /Indus Valley Civilization (IVC) in India Using Isotope & Latest Chronological Techniques (CVO)' feels that funds have reached at right time to maintain the pace of the research.

short_message: Kudos to those fine citizens of the realm who have already contributed to the Paper Collection Drive! For those haven't contributed yet, we request you
message:
Kudos to those fine citizens of the realm who have already contributed to the Paper Collection Drive! For those haven't contributed yet, we request you again to submit your mid-semester question papers - keeping in mind that even a single paper could help out a large batch of existing and future students - especially with the Library site going down regularly this time.

Here's how you can contribute - Click, Upload & Send.

(1) Take picture(s) of your question paper
(2) Visit http://metakgp.github.io/... and click the upload button
(3) Attach your images in the mail, and send the mail.

Never go to an exam without having had a look at the previous year's paper! Let's all work together in order to achieve this goal.

Have a great week ahead. And awesome Durga Puja hols ahead of that. That's all folks!

message:
Inter Hall Athletics 2016-17

After two days of rigorous efforts and perseverance displayed by our athletes, the final GC standings (men) are as follows:

1. MS: 84 points
2. LBS: 29 points
3. Nehru: 24 points
4. RP: 23 points

MS Hall of Residence single-handedly dominated the athletics event and came out with flying colours. The points' difference has widened this year which reflects their consistency and dominance.

Final standings (Women):

1. SN: 48 points
2. MT: 13 points
3. SAM: 10 points

SN Hall of Residence kept its head high and won the athletics meet by a wide margin.

Team TSA congratulates all winners.

Congratulations to Team Aerial Robotics of IIT Kharagpur
message:
Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur shared Director IIT Kharagpur's photo.

Congratulations to Team Aerial Robotics of IIT Kharagpur for their prize-winning performance in the 'International Aerial Robotics Competition', Asia-Pacific Venue during 23-24th September, 2016 in Beijing China. They were awarded 'Best Team Cooperation Award' for their efforts out of total 9 teams from China and India (only our team from India). The team members are: Soumyadeep Mukherjee, Aditya Agarwal, Gaurav Gardi, Kumar Ankit, Kumar Krishna Agarwal, Manash Pratim Das, Sai Ram, Vishnu Sharma

It is a research group sponsored by the Institute through SRIC as part of Centre for Excellence in Robotics. The principal Investigator for the project is Prof. Somesh Kumar (MA) and it is mentored by Prof. Jayanta Mukhopadhyay (CSE) and Prof. D.K. Pratihar (ME).

Carrying on this novel approach
message:
Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur shared Branding And Relations Cell, IIT Kharagpur's photo.

Carrying on this novel approach of rediscovering ancient Indian history, the Institute in association with Branding And Relations Cell, IIT Kharagpur has organized a lecture under the Science and Heritage Initiative (SandHI) titled 'Astronomical Dating and Re-evaluating Ancient Indian Chronology' by Professor Amitabha Ghosh.

Date: October 3, 2016 (Monday) || Time: 5:30 P.M.
Venue: Kalidas Auditorium

Prof. Amitabha Ghosh is Former Director and Distinguished Professor, IIT Kharagpur, Platinum Jubilee Senior Scientist of The National Academy of Sciences India.

You are cordially invited to be part of this rediscovery of ancient Indian heritage through scientific means. Let us trace back our roots which would strengthen our identity as Indians and global citizens.

story: The Scholars' Avenue shared Director IIT Kharagpur's photo.
short_message:
The Scholars' Avenue shared Director IIT Kharagpur's photo.

Prof M A Rege, ex-HoD Department of Architecture & Regional Planning, IIT
message:
The Scholars' Avenue shared Director IIT Kharagpur's photo.

Prof M A Rege, ex-HoD Department of Architecture & Regional Planning, IIT Kharagpur is no more. Fondly remembered by many students and admirers.

Amherst - Madhukar Anant Rege passed away at age 92, on September 20th, 2016, after a long illness and a long, full life on three continents.

Born in Ratnagiri on the Konkan Coast of India, he had a happy, active childhood. From an early age he loved drawing and painting and eventually earned a Diploma in Architecture at the J.J. School of Art in Bombay, after apprenticing for a year with the master watercolorist Sawlaram Haldankar. In 1949, at age 25, he set sail for England with the help of his eldest brother Vinayak, where he successfully sat the R.I.B.A. (Royal Institute of British Architects) examination and then completed a post-graduate Diploma in Town Planning.

It was in England that he met and married Gladys Sharp on July 4th, 1953, and, after the birth of their first daughter in 1954, returned to India, where he took up a lectureship in Architecture at the newly formed Indian Institute of Technology in Kharagpur, West Bengal. He was to stay at I.I.T. for 14 years, aside from a year's leave in London and a three-year period in Athens, Greece where he worked with the pioneering Doxiadis Associates, after which he returned to Kharagpur as Professor and Head of the Department of Architecture and City Planning.

In 1969 he migrated to the United States, first as a SPURS (Special Program for Urban and Regional Studies) Fellow at M.I.T. in Cambridge, Massachusetts, then as a city planner for the City of Newton and eventually as a planner for the Massachusetts Executive Office of Communities and Development, where he worked in the Main Street Program on downtown revitalization of Mass. cities and towns. He also lectured at the Boston Architectural Center. When his wife and daughters joined him in 1970, he moved first to Brookline, then to Newton, and, upon retirement in 1993, settled with Gladys in Amherst. After retirement he returned to his first passion, painting, which he had kept up throughout his life, filling his home with beauty.

He was a true Renaissance man: a lifelong reader, always with his head in a book, but also an avid gardener. For many years he practiced yoga regularly. He made toys for his children and most of the furniture for his family, taught himself leatherwork, loved philosophical and political discussions, music, swimming, tennis, and cooking, and was a staunch Democrat, making sure to vote, by absentee ballot, even during his last illness.

He leaves behind Gladys, his loving wife of 63 years; daughters Josna Rege, in Amherst and Sally Rege Carroll, in North Reading, Massachusetts; grandsons Nikhil, in New York City, and Tyler, also from North Reading, currently studying at UMass Amherst; sisters Kumud Rege and Sunita Kulkarni, and brothers Prabhakar and Sadanand Rege, all in Mumbai, India; sons-in-law Andrew and Kevin, many loving nieces and nephews, brothers- and sisters-in law, and fast friends in India, England, and the United States. A great loss to us all, but a life well lived.

Beers and Story Belchertown Funeral Home has been entrusted with the arrangements.

short_message:
Good Evening!

The efforts to renovate the standards of the Indian Railways, one of the world's largest rail networks, have been set into motion
message:
Good Evening!

The efforts to renovate the standards of the Indian Railways, one of the world's largest rail networks, have been set into motion with IIT Kharagpur being roped in to bring about a marvelous change. The proposed ideas, once implemented, will hopefully push us to the top among the more technologically advanced,efficient and passenger-friendly railway networks.

12 Research projects have been awarded to IIT KGP with synergies between the metallurgical, civil, mechanical, chemical, electrical, and electronics and electrical communications departments being the focal point of the plan. The unique Rubber Technology Centre also has a crucial part to play in this project (for those you know who don't know, yes this is a legitimate place in our campus which does legitimate work).A lot of these research projects are in the final stages of testing.

Let's hope to see our institute shoulder the responsibility of tackling many other pressing issues and live up to our motto.

For further details, please follow the link below:
http://indianexpress.com/...

short_message: IIT Kharagpur is going to host the quarter-finals of the prestigious Hult Prize 2017. IIT Kharagpur has been chosen as the venue along with IIT Delhi,
message:
IIT Kharagpur is going to host the quarter-finals of the prestigious Hult Prize 2017. IIT Kharagpur has been chosen as the venue along with IIT Delhi, BITS Pilani, IIM Ahmedabad and IIM Indore, where separate quarter finals will be held.
This is to note that till 2013 only top tech and business schools of Europe and US could be venues for quarter finals. After ISB Hyderabad winning the 2014 competition made the organizers to re-think about allowing the quarterfinals to be held at Indian venues.
To know more about Hult Prize please go through the following document: https://drive.google.com/...

story: Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur shared Metakgp's post.
short_message:
Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur shared Metakgp's post.

Greetings, fine citizens of the realm! We hope your mid-semester
message:
Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur shared Metakgp's post.

Greetings, fine citizens of the realm! We hope your mid-semester exams went well.

As the library site was down for most part of mid-semester exams, our site MFQP was also rendered to be down for the first few days, but we found a way out so that we could keep serving papers to everyone in KGP! Now, let's all contribute, and increase the papers MFQP has. Our Paper Collection Drive starts today! We request everyone to submit their mid-semester question papers.

Here's how you can contribute - Click, Upload & Send.

1. Take a picture of your question paper
2. Write Subject Code in email

Students who won't possess Aadhar card number after this may face disqualification from UGC, CSIR and other funding agencies by way of stoppage of scholarships/ loans etc.

Good evening people,

We hope you are settling back into the routine of attending classes after the mid semester examinations. With the recent
message:
Good evening people,

We hope you are settling back into the routine of attending classes after the mid semester examinations. With the recent introduction of the science of happiness courses in the institute, we have yet another interesting news coming out .

The Defence Research Development Organisation (DRDO) has approached IIT- Kharagpur to put smiles back on the faces of Indian jawans. DRDO will shortly tie up with IIT-Kgp to work out methods that will increase the happiness quotient of Indian soldiers.

“This is an emerging discipline and is going to be one of the key pillars by which human development will happen,” our Director said.

We are excited to see how this initiative pans out in the future.

http://www.hindustantimes...

short_message: आई आई टी खड़गपुर बहुत जल्द 'Science of Happiness' का माइक्रो क्रेडिट कोर्स शुरू करने वाला है। पहले चरण के तहत संस्थान ने दो दिन की अंतरराष्ट्रीय कार्यशाला
message:
आई आई टी खड़गपुर बहुत जल्द 'Science of Happiness' का माइक्रो क्रेडिट कोर्स शुरू करने वाला है। पहले चरण के तहत संस्थान ने दो दिन की अंतरराष्ट्रीय कार्यशाला का आयोजन किया है। इस कार्यशाला में आई आई टी खड़गपुर के छात्रों ने भाग लेते हुए अपने अध्ययन को पोस्टर के माध्यम से प्रदर्शित किया। हमसे बात करते हुए आई आई टी खड़गपुर के Ph. D. Research Scholar,लक्ष्मी कान्त तिवारी ने बताया 'आज-कल लोग अपनी भाग दौड़ भरी जिंदगी में इतने व्यस्त हैं कि उनको अपना खुद का ख्याल रखने का समय भी नहीं मिल पाता है। इसी कारण से पाया गया है कि उनको कई प्रकार की बीमारियां हो जाती हैं और जब तक उनको बीमारी का पता चलता है तब तक काफी देर हो चुकी होती है। इसी कड़ी में नींद न आने से संबंधित बीमारियां भी हैं। विश्व स्तर पर रिसर्च करने से पता चलता है कि करीब ३४ प्रतिशत लोग नींद न आने से संबंधित बीमारी से ग्रस्त है। विश्व स्वास्थ्य संगठन के हिसाब से १७.४ प्रतिशत मौत सिर्फ श्वास की बीमारी के कारण होती है और ४० प्रतिशत भारत के लोग २०२० तक ह्रदय से सम्बंधित बीमारियों से ग्रस्त हो जायेंगे। अगर इस प्रकार की गंभीर बीमारियों के बारे में समय रहते पता चल जाता है तो अकारण मौत के मुँह में जाने से लोगो को बचाया जा सकता है।'

क्या वास्तव में विज्ञान से लोग खुश हो सकते हैं ? इसके जवाब में आई आई टी खड़गपुर के छात्रों ने बताया कि उनका सबसे पहला प्रयास तकनीक और खुशी को आपस में जोड़ना है। खुशहाल लोग जीवन को बड़ी आसानी से जीते हैं और बीमारियों के प्रभाव से दूर रहते हैं।

तिवारी जी ने बताया कि हम सभी लोग अपने जीवन का एक तिहाई भाग सिर्फ सोने में बिताते हैं और जिन लोगों को रात में अच्छे से नींद नहीं आती है वो लोग पूरे दिन थकावट महसूस करते हैं और कई बार अपनी काम करने की जगह पर ही सो जाते हैं। ऐसे लोग चिड़चिड़े भी होते हैं और समाज में उनका व्यवहार भी सही नहीं होता है। असल में इस प्रकार के लोग किसी न किसी प्रकार की सोने से सम्बंधित बीमारी से ग्रस्त रहते है और चौंकाने वाली बात यह है कि उनमें से बहुत सारे लोगों को यह पता भी नहीं होता है।

प्रोफ़ेसर अरविंद के पर्यवेक्षण में काम कर रहे कुछ छात्रों ने तीन प्रकार की स्लीप मॉनिटरिंग डिवाइसेस को ईजाद किया है। उनकी पहली डिवाइस बेडशीट की तरह है जिसको उपयोगकर्ता को अपने बेडशीट के निचे सोने से पहले बिछाना होगा। इस डिवाइस में एक विशेष प्रकार का सेंसर लगा है जो उपयोगकर्ता के ह्रदय की धड़कन और सांस की गति को नापता है।अगर उपयोगकर्ता को श्वास या ह्रदय से जुडी कोई भी बीमारी है तो यह विशेष प्रकार का सेंसर उसे पकड़ लेता है और बीमारी से जुड़ी जानकारी उपयोगकर्ता के मोबाइल पर भेज देता है। इसके अलावा इसमें और भी तमाम प्रकार के सेंसर्स लगे हैं जो आपके बेडरूम की हवा की गुणवत्ता, तापमान और आद्रता के स्तर को भी नापता है।
दूसरी प्रकार की डिवाइस भी उपयोगकर्ता को श्वास या ह्रदय से जुडी बीमारी से अवगत कराता है परंतु ह्रदय की धड़कन और सांस की गति को नापने का तरीका पूरी तरह से अलग है। इस दूसरे प्रकार की डिवाइस को उपयोगकर्ता के बेडरूम में कहीं एक जगह दीवार पर लगा सकते हैं। यह डिवाइस पूरी तरह से वायरलेस टेक्नोलॉजी पर आधारित है।
तीसरी प्रकार की डिवाइस थर्मल इमेजिंग के सिद्धांत पर काम करती है, यह डिवाइस उपयोगकर्ता के शरीर के तापमान को नापती है और उसी के आधार पर उपयोगकर्ता के स्टेट ऑफ़ स्लीप का आंकलन कर लेती है।
बाजार में आने के बाद इन डिवाइसेस की कीमत ७००० से ८००० के आस पास होगी और अगले ६ या ७ महीने में डिवाइसेस बाजार में आ जाएंगे।
To see more:
http://navbharattimes.ind...

आई आई टी खड़गपुर बहुत जल्द 'Science of Happiness' का माइक्रो क्रेडिट कोर्स शुरू करने वाला है। पहले चरण के तहत संस्थान ने दो दिन की अंतरराष्ट्रीय कार्यशाला का आयोजन किया है। इस कार्यशाला में आई आई टी खड़गपुर के छात्रों ने भाग लेते हुए अपने अध्यनन को पोस्टर के माध्यम से प्रदर्शित किया। हमसे बात करते हुए आई आई टी खड़गपुर के Ph. D. Research Scholar,लक्ष्मी कान्त तिवारी ने बताया 'आज-कल लोग अपनी भाग दौड़ भरी जिंदगी में इतना व्यस्त है कि उनको अपना खुद का ख्याल रखने का समय भी नहीं मिल पाता है। इसी कारण से पाया गया है कि उनको कई प्रकार की बीमारियाँ हो जाती हैं और जब तक उनको बीमारी का पता चलता है तब तक काफी देर हो चुकी होती है। इसी कड़ी में नींद न आने से संबंधित बीमारियाँ भी हैं। विश्व स्तर पर रिसर्च करने से पता चलता है कि करीब ३४ प्रतिशत लोग नींद न आने से संबंधित बीमारी से ग्रस्त है। विश्व सवास्थ्य संगठन के हिसाब से १७.४ प्रतिशत मौते सिर्फ श्वास की बीमारी के कारण होती है और ४० प्रतिशत भारत के लोग २०२० तक ह्रदय से सम्बंधित बीमारियों से ग्रस्त हो जायेंगे। अगर इस प्रकार की गंभीर बीमारियों के बारे में समय रहते पता चल जाता है तो अकारण मौत के मुँह में जाने से लोगो को बचाया जा सकता है।'

क्या वास्तव में विज्ञान से लोग खुश हो सकते है? इसके जवाब में आई आई टी खड़गपुर के छात्रों ने बताया कि उनका सबसे पहला प्रयास तकनीक और खुशी को आपस में जोड़ना है। खुशहाल लोग जीवन को बड़ी आसानी से जीते हैं और बीमारियों के प्रभाव से दूर रहते हैं।

तिवारी जी ने बताया कि हम सभी लोग अपने जीवन का एक तिहाई भाग सिर्फ सोने में बिताते है और जिन लोगो को रात में अच्छे से नींद नहीं आती है वो लोग पुरे दिन थकावट महसूस करते हैं और कई बार अपनी काम करने की जगह पर ही सो जाते हैं। ऐसे लोग चिड़चिड़े भी होते हैं और समाज में उनका व्यवहार भी सही नहीं होता हैं। असल में इस प्रकार के लोग किसी न किसी प्रकार की सोने से सम्बंधित बीमारी से ग्रस्त रहते हैं और चौकाने वाली बात यह है कि उनमें से बहुत सारे लोगों को पता भी नहीं होता हैं।

प्रोफ़ेसर अरविंद के पर्यवेक्षण में काम कर रहे कुछ छात्रों ने तीन प्रकार की स्लीप मॉनिटरिंग डिवासेज को ईजाद किया है। उनकी पहली डिवाइस बेडशीट की तरह है जिसको उपयोगकर्ता को अपने बेडशीट के निचे सोने से पहले बिछाना होगा। इस डिवाइस में एक विशेष प्रकार का सेंसर लगा है जो उपयोगकर्ता के ह्रदय की धड़कन और सांस की गति को नापता है।अगर उपयोगकर्ता को श्वास या ह्रदय से जुडी कोई भी बीमारी है तो यह विशेष प्रकार का सेंसर उसे पकड़ लेता है और बीमारी से जुड़ी जानकारी उपयोगकर्ता के मोबाइल पर भेज देता है। इसके अलावा इसमें और भी तमाम प्रकार के सेंसर्स लगे हैं जो आपके बैडरूम की हवा की गुणवत्ता, तापमान और आद्रता के स्तर को भी नापता है।
दूसरी प्रकार की डिवाइस भी उपयोगकर्ता को श्वास या ह्रदय से जुडी बीमारी से अवगत कराता है परंतु ह्रदय की धड़कन और सांस की गति को नापने का तरीका पूरी तरह से अलग है। इस दूसरे प्रकार की डिवाइस को उपयोगकर्ता के बैडरूम में कहीं एक जगह दीवार पर लगा सकते हैं। यह डिवाइस पूरी तरह से वायरलेस टेक्नोलॉजी पर आधारित है।
तीसरी प्रकार की डिवाइस थर्मल इमेजिंग के सिद्धांत पर काम करती है, यह डिवाइस उपयोगकर्ता के शरीर के तापमान को नापती है और उसी के आधार पर उपयोगकर्ता के स्टेट ऑफ़ स्लीप का आंकलन कर लेती है।
बाजार में आने के बाद इन डिवाइसेस की कीमत ७००० से ८००० के आस पास होगी और अगले ६ या ७ महीने में डिवाइसेस बाजार में आ जाएंगे।
To see more:
http://navbharattimes.ind...

short_message:
Hey everyone,

In recent interesting developments, IIT Kharagpur is to offer courses on the science of happiness starting today (24.9.2016).
message:
Hey everyone,

In recent interesting developments, IIT Kharagpur is to offer courses on the science of happiness starting today (24.9.2016). “We are looking to the next level... First, it was physical sciences. Now, it’s the study of consciousness,” said Partha Pratim Chakrabarti, our Director.

The courses, to be offered at both undergraduate and post graduate levels, will teach science of happiness, stress management, coping with loss and positive psychology. He also made it clear that while the courses would be available to only IIT students in the first year, the institute will consider opening up the programme to non-IITians from 2017. Here's the full story:-

http://indianexpress.com/...

short_message:
प्रिय विद्यार्थियो, संस्थान के समस्त आदरणीय कार्मिकगण,
हिंदी दिवस 2016 आयोजन की श्रृंखला में संस्थान में अनेक कार्यक्रम आयोजित किए जा रहे हैं। इसी
message:
प्रिय विद्यार्थियो, संस्थान के समस्त आदरणीय कार्मिकगण,
हिंदी दिवस 2016 आयोजन की श्रृंखला में संस्थान में अनेक कार्यक्रम आयोजित किए जा रहे हैं। इसी क्रम में दिनांक 26 सितम्बर 2016 को शाम 1500 बजे से एक कार्यक्रम- “मातृभाषा काव्य पाठ प्रतियोगिता, काव्य संध्या, एवं साहित्यिक गीतों की संगीतमय प्रस्तुति” का किया जा रहा है। इस कार्यक्रम में संस्थान छात्रों, कार्मिकों एवं उनके परिवारीजनों सहित उनके मित्रगणों का भी स्वागत है।
इस प्रतियोगिता में आप अपनी मातृभाषा में एक कविता स्वयं की लिखी हुई अथवा किसी प्रतिष्ठित कवि की रचना प्रस्तुत कर सकते हैं। न्यायमंडल के रुप में कोलकाता से सुप्रतिष्ठित कवि ऋषि श्री योगेन्द्र शुक्ल, काव्य मर्मज्ञ प्रो. प्रेम शंकर त्रिपाठी, सुप्रसिद्ध गजलकार श्री नंद लाल रोशन तथा टाटानगर से अतिसम्मानित गीतकार प्रो. शेष नाथ सिंह एवं श्री शैलेष जी को आमंत्रित किया गया है। प्रतिभागियों के काव्य पाठ के पश्चात न्यायमंडल के सदस्य युवा प्रतिभागियों के लिए सुझाव एवं परामर्श देंगे तथा अपनी चुनींदा रचनाओं का पाठ करेंगे।
हमारे साहित्यिक गीत हमारी सांस्कृतिक धरोहर हैं। श्री ओम प्रकाश मिश्र जी अखिल भारतीय स्तर पर साहित्यिक गीतों की संगीतमय प्रस्तुति के लिए जाने जाते हैं। एक अनूठा आयोजन एवं अद्भुत अनुभव रहता है श्री मिश्र जी को सुनना और हर आंख भर आती है जब वे माँ, पिता, भाई, बहन, बिटिया, पुत्र, परिवार, समाज, बदरिया, किसान आदि पर बच्चन, नागार्जुन, दिनकर, यश मालवीय, ओम व्यास, आचार्य विष्णुकांत शास्त्री आदि परम पूज्य साहित्यकारों की रचनाओं की संगीतमय प्रस्तुति करते हैं।
आपसे निवेदन है कि काव्यपाठ प्रतियोगिता हेतु अपनी एक सर्वश्रेष्ठ कविता, गीत तैयार कर सहभागिता करें। rajbhasha@hijli.iitkpg.ernet.in अथवा hindiofficeriitkharagpur@gmail.com पर अपना पंजीकरण अनिवार्यतः कराएं। विजेताओं को आकर्षक पुरस्कार हिंदी दिवस समापन समारोह में किसी अन्य दिन दिए जाएंगे।
कृपया इस संदेश को अधिक से अधिक साथियों, मित्रों, परिवारों, समूहों तक पहुंचाएं।
निवेदक
अध्यक्ष
राजभाषा विभाग
भारतीय प्रौद्योगिकी संस्थान खड़गपुर

short_message: All the students are advised not to visit the Gole Bazaar area in the next 3-4 days in view of the prevailing tension in the aftermath of the alleged death
message:
All the students are advised not to visit the Gole Bazaar area in the next 3-4 days in view of the prevailing tension in the aftermath of the alleged death of an 18 year youth, who was beaten by the locals after a nominal bike collision last night, finally succumbing to injuries.
The situation is still grim with several shops set on fire and the mob attacking the police while the latter lobbed tear gas shells to control the case. We are having a close eye on the development and if the situation doesn't improve, section 144 (Prohibition on unlawful assembly) of the Indian Penal Code shall be imposed tomorrow, said Shri JP Meena, District Magistrate, Paschim Medinipur.

Source: Anandabazar Patrika (A Bengali Daily)

short_message: A group of 15 students from the Department of Biotechnology has earned the rare distinction of being invited to showcase their unique genetic engineering
message:
A group of 15 students from the Department of Biotechnology has earned the rare distinction of being invited to showcase their unique genetic engineering skills at the world’s biggest competition in the field — the International Genetically Engineered Machine (IGEM) — at Boston, the United States to be held between October 27 and 31. The event is hosted at Hynes convention centre, Boston. They will demonstrate a technique devised to extract spider silk in an economical and quicker way. This will be the second time that IIT-KGP will be participating in this competition since its inception in 2004.
The spider silk, due to its high tensile strength and elasticity, has potential applications as a bio-material and since it is bio-compatible and biodegradable, it has great use in medical and pharmaceutical industries.
Courtesy: Hindustan Times

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates them and wishes them All the Best for the event.

story: The Scholars' Avenue shared Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur's post.
short_message:
The Scholars' Avenue shared Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur's post.

An RTI filed to the MHRD has revealed that the annual electric bill paid by
message:
The Scholars' Avenue shared Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur's post.

An RTI filed to the MHRD has revealed that the annual electric bill paid by IIT Kharagpur to the Ministry of Energy & Power Distribution, Govt. of West Bengal, has surged steeply from Rupees 16 crores 18 lakhs in 2011 to an almost double of 31 crores 46 lakhs in 2016. Despite the introduction of several savings and alternative measures like replacement of traditional halogen street lamps with LED, sensor operated lights and installation of solar panels, this sharp upswing whereas can be attributed to an increase in research facilities and functioning of four new halls viz. RLB, LBS, BRH & NVH; it cannot be ruled out completely that the misuse and wastage do not have a colossal rise. The hall and department wise data obtained from the Electric Office unveils that the consumption has increased drastically in almost every hall and department.
Many a times we are seen to leave the lights and fans running while we go to the class; not because of our unwillingness but because of our carelessness. We should always remember that there are still 19,706 villages in our India (Data as of 2015, Census Board, Ministry of Home Affairs, Govt. of India) which remain un-electrified even after 69 years of our independence. Around 12% of our population do not know how does it feel to spend nights with lights!

We, from Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur urge each one of us to please use the electricity and water judiciously and encourage our friends towards the same. After all, every small contribution counts!

समर शेष है, नहीं पाप का भागी केवल व्याध,
जो तटस्थ हैं समय लिखेगा उनका भी अपराध। - राष्ट्रकवि डॉ श्री रामधारी सिंह 'दिनकर'

short_message: What KGP lacks in the absence of high rises, it compensates in the sheer amount of self-motivated student groups or 'societies' as we call them, that cater
message:
What KGP lacks in the absence of high rises, it compensates in the sheer amount of self-motivated student groups or 'societies' as we call them, that cater to almost all kind of students: creative, intellectual, managerial or welfare inclined.

You just have to name it and you'll have a group of people actively pursuing it. But the question remains, how do we know what exists? Or, how many groups are present here in our campus?

This is a question that might haunt one's brain as soon as they enter the campus, but it soon fades into oblivion and one might miss the chance to get into a society that aligns with their interests.

We finally decided to compile a one-stop list of all the campus societies that we know of till date.

Presenting to you in an interactive format that might just make you forgive Mendeleev a bit.

The Periodic Table of KGPian Societies, everybody!

https://thescholarsavenue...

P.S: Any societies that need any edits in their respective sections can ping us, or mail us (thescholarsavenue@ gmail.com ) with the edits.
We have only accounted groups that are open to all and are not limited by the Departments and we agree that we might have missed a few nevertheless.
Also, this link is not mobile-friendly yet.

short_message:
Good Morning Folks!
We hope all your days are running well. The saga of waking up just 5 minutes before class is an everlasting one with consequences
message:
Good Morning Folks!
We hope all your days are running well. The saga of waking up just 5 minutes before class is an everlasting one with consequences that might lead to cycle collisions thanks to some of the new changes in rules around here. But for what it's worth, the IIT tag looms large before you and you might as well put these things at the back of your mind.
But there are some things we do look forward to. Scaling the peak of the most coveted institute in the world, the Massachusetts Institute of Technology, is everybody's dream. Getting admission into MIT is an objectively quantified pinnacle of achievement.

Well, that explains the rat race we were put into from a very young age, right? It means that we, with our degrees and achievements, are the ones who are capable of following this road.
Or does it?

Here is a story that will shatter such narrow conceptions and hopefully rekindle the fire for 'learning' within you. The most important thing in one's life is to question everything and set upon a journey to find the answers. The present system of education is stuck in a deep quagmire of controversy, but in the end it is the passion and interest of a person that will actually propel him/her forward.

Read about the inspiring story here: http://www.hindustantimes...

story: Technology, IIT Kharagpur shared Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur's post.
short_message:
Technology, IIT Kharagpur shared Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur's post.

SRISTI celebrates the creativity and innovation
message:
Technology, IIT Kharagpur shared Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur's post.

SRISTI celebrates the creativity and innovation of young technological students by recognising their outstanding projects with Gandhian Young Technological Innovation (GYTI) Awards. These awards are given every year during the Festival of Innovation (FOIN) at Rashtrapati Bhawan in the month of March. Next year, these awards are due tentatively on March 5, 2017 at FOIN. It is hoped that such recognition will enthuse young innovators to pursue even more outstanding research addressing unmet social needs and set up entrepreneurial ventures in consonance with Start-Up movement gaining strength currently in India.
Any student project that has been completed during 2014-15 to 2016-17 is eligible for consideration of awards.The students need to submit the projects at following URL: www.gyti.techpedia.in.

Financial support is also given to some of the awardees as per numerous windows of opportunity:

Last date for submission of entries is November 30, 2016

You can email your queries to gyti.techpedia@sristi.org ,or call at 9099258492.

short_message: A senior astrophysicist at NASA, Prof. Mather is the recipient of 2006 Nobel prize in Physics. He is a senior project scientist at JSWT, which will be
message:
A senior astrophysicist at NASA, Prof. Mather is the recipient of 2006 Nobel prize in Physics. He is a senior project scientist at JSWT, which will be successor to Hubble Space Telescope. He was part of the COBE satellite, which confirmed the Big Bang theory. He was listed twice by TIME magazine; among 100 most influential people in the world in 2007 and then again in 2012 among 25 most influential people in space.

Strengthen the foundation of your thoughts through his precious words.

Date: 29th February (Monday), 6:30 PM
Venue: CET Studio 1, First Floor, Takshashila

short_message: A PAN IIT interactive session with Prof. Herald Haas has been arranged on 14th February at 6:30PM. Prof. Haas holds the Chair of Mobile Communications
message:
A PAN IIT interactive session with Prof. Herald Haas has been arranged on 14th February at 6:30PM. Prof. Haas holds the Chair of Mobile Communications at the University of Edinburgh. He is acclaimed to be the inventor of Light Fidelity (Li-Fi) which was listed among the 50 best inventions in TIME Magazine 2011.

Link for webcast is http://nknvcreplay.nic.in...

Link will be live from Sunday (14th Feb.) 6:30 PM onward. Venue for online interaction is NKN Virtual Classroom, JCB Lab Complex.

Note: The event will consist of a keynote speech from 6:30 PM - 8:00 PM. Q&A session will be from 8:15 PM.
